channel.title: Homepage on Laboratory
channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on Laboratory

item.title: Imaging following agarose gel electrophoresis (AGE)
item.description:
imaging in general, but add that lanes with samples for gel extraction need to be cut off prior to imaging.

Subsequent Purification
⚠️ For downstream purification, cut away all lanes with samples that are intended for later gel extraction. UV light is mutagenic and can damage or alter DNA, so the band intended for purification should not be exposed to UV light. Instead, determine its position by imaging only the well containing the corresponding sample intended for UV imaging.

dATP, dTTP, dGTP, dCTP 10 mM each

0.5 µL/sample each
2 µL/sample
for mastermix preparation
for mastermix preparation

DNA template with GOI 10 ng/µL 1 µL/sample

Procedure:

Calculating the annealing temperature and elongation duration for the GOI:

Annealing Temperature Calculation

The annealing temperature Ta can be calculated from the melting temperature Tm or looked up within SnapGene.

item.title: Agarose Gel Electrophoresis (AGE)
item.description:
⚠️ Each Sample must have a concentration of at least 20 ng/µL, as 20 ng is the least amount that can be detected using EtBr.
‼️ EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
❗️ DNA intercalators such as Roti GelStain are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Materials

Equipment & Devices Amount Specifications  Location
power source manual
casting tray
well comb
electrophoresis chamber
Commercial Kits⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications  Location
pipetmans and sterile pipette tips
Reaction Tube 1.5 ml 1/gel
1/sample		 for mastermix preparation
for sample preparation
Reagents & Solutions⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
agarose default 0.35 g/50 mL gel solid
Tris-acetat-EDTA (TAE) buffer ~150 mL/gel 50 mL for gel
~100 mL as electrophoresis buffer
gel stain
ethidium bromide
Roti GelStain
0.2–0.5µg/mL (1–2.5 µL/gel)
1 µL/gel
stock 10mg/mL
ready-to-use
dsH2O see mastermix calculator below for sample dilution/for mastermix preparation
DNA loading buffer 5x see mastermix calculator below for sample preparation/for mastermix preparation
DNA ladder
HyperLadder 1kb
usually 10 µL/gel
5 µL/well (first and last well)
Biological Materials⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
DNA sample at least 10 ng/well

Procedure:

Preparing the gel:

  1. Weigh the correct amount of agarose:

Hyperladder 1kb:

range of effective separation [bp] agarose gel percentage [%] agarose per gel [g/50mL]
2,000–50,000 0.5 0.25
1,000–20,000 0.6 0.30
800–12,000 0.7 0.35
800–10,000 (default) 0.8 0.40
600–10,000 0.9 0.45
400–8,000 1.0 0.50
300–7,000 1.2 0.60
200–3,000 1.5 0.75
100–2,000 2.0 1.00
25–1,000 3.0 1.50
10-500 4.0 2.00
10-300 5.0 2.50
  1. Add 50 mL of TAE buffer.
  2. Place in microwave and heat in bursts with swaying in between until boiling and until clear.
  3. Let cool down to approximately 50°C in a water bath or under running water until only warm to touch.
  4. Add gel stain.
  • The standard concentration of ethidium bromide is 0.2µg/mL to 0.5µg/mL, which amounts to 1µL to 2.5µL per 50mL gel for a stock concentration of 10mg/mL.
‼️ EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
  • The standard amount of Roti GelStain is 1µL per 50mL gel.
❗️ DNA intercalators, such as Roti GelStain, are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Casting the Gel:

  1. Place the casting tray into the gel chamber rotated 90° to prevent the gel from running in the chamber.
  2. Place the well comb.
  3. Pour in the gel from a corner on the opposite site from the well comb.
  4. Remove all bubbles, especially near the comb or where the DNA will be running, if necessary.
  5. Let the gel solidify for approximately 30 minutes.

Preparing the DNA:

ℹ️ Prepare a mastermix when doing multiple samples with similar DNA concentration containing dsH2O and DNA loading buffer 5x. Use number of samples plus at least one for the mastermix volume multiplyer.
1. Prepare a Mastermix:
Volume V [µL] Reagent Concentration c1 [ng/µL]
Mass m1 [ng]		 Concentration c2 [ng/µL]
Mass m2 [ng]
1 µL DNA loading buffer
3 µL dsH2O
= 4 µL
Mastermix Preparation Calculator

Number of samples:

Desired well volume:

Preparing the gel:

  1. Weigh the correct amount of agarose:

Hyperladder 1kb:

range of effective separation [bp] agarose gel percentage [%] agarose per gel [g/50mL]
2,000–50,000 0.5 0.25
1,000–20,000 0.6 0.30
800–12,000 0.7 0.35

400–8,000 1.0 0.50

200–3,000 1.5 0.75
100–2,000 2.0 1.00
25–1,000 3.0 1.50
10-500 4.0 2.00
10-300 5.0 2.50
  1. Add 50 mL of TAE buffer.
  2. Place in microwave and heat in bursts with swaying in between until boiling and until clear.
  3. Let cool down to approximately 50°C in a water bath or under running water until only warm to touch.
  4. Add gel stain.
  • The standard concentration of ethidium bromide is 0.2µg/mL to 0.5µg/mL, which amounts to 1µL to 2.5µL per 50mL gel for a stock concentration of 10mg/mL.
‼️ EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
  • The standard amount of Roti GelStain is 1µL per 50mL gel.
❗️ DNA intercalators, such as Roti GelStain, are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Casting the Gel:

  1. Place the casting tray into the gel chamber rotated 90° to prevent the gel from running in the chamber.
  2. Place the well comb.
  3. Pour in the gel from a corner on the opposite site from the well comb.
  4. Remove all bubbles, especially near the comb or where the DNA will be running, if necessary.
  5. Let the gel solidify for approximately 30 minutes.

Preparing the DNA:

  1. Mix the whole PCR reaction mixture with the appropriate amount of DNA loading buffer.

item.title: Bacterial Transformation
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
heating block manual with shaker function
bucket of ice
Commercial Kits⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications  Location
pipetmans and sterile pipette tips
reaction tube 1.5 mL 1/transformation for LB medium
Reagents & Solutions⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
Luria-Bertani medium 1 mL/one-shot
LB agar plate 2/one-shot with suitable selection antibiotic
with X-gal for blue-white selection
X-gal for blue/white selection if not already in plate
Biological Materials⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
plasmid 1–10 ng (e.g. 0.5–5 µL of 2 ng/µL)
100-200 ng (e.g. 1-2 µL of 100 ng/µL)		 for standard transformations
for difficult transformations
one-shot of suitable competent bacteria 1/transformation

Procedure:

Selecting a suitable Strain:

Strain Application Features
E. coli DH5α medium-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli TOP10 high-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli XL1blue plasmid DNA expression
with blue/white screening
E. coli BL21(DE3) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli BL21(DE3) pLysS (toxic) protein expression T7 Inhibitor
E. coli Rosetta(DE3) (eucaryotic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C41(DE3) toxic protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C43(DE3) toxic membrane protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase

Preparations:

  1. Thaw a one-shot of competent bacteria per transformation on ice for approximately 5 minutes.
  2. Thaw the Plasmid on ice.
  3. Pre-warm 1100 µL of LB medium per transformation to 37 °C.

Transformation:

  1. Add 1–10 ng (up to 100-200 ng for difficult dransformations) of plasmid DNA to a one shot of 50–100 µL of competent cells.
  2. Mix the bacteria by flicking or gentle stirring.
  3. Incubate transformation mix on ice for 30 minutes.
0:30:00
🔔
  1. Pre-heat a heating block or water bath to 42 °C.
  2. Incubate transformation mix in a heating block or water bath @ 42 °C for 45 to 60 seconds.
0:01:00
🔔
  1. Incubate transformation mix on ice for 5 minutes.
0:05:00
🔔
  1. Add 900 µL LB medium to the transformation mix.
  2. Incubate transformation mix on a heating block @ 37 °C and @ 250 rpm for 1 h.
1:00:00
🔔

Plate Preparation:

  1. Take two LB-agar Plates containing the appropriate antibiotic out of the fridge and let them warm up to RT.
  2. For blue/white selection plate 20 µL of X-Gal on the Plates and let dry before plating any bacteria.

Plating:

  1. Plate 100 µL of the 1000 μL bacterial suspension on one of the LB agar Plate.
  2. Centrifuge the residual 900 µL @ 11,000 g for 30 s.
0:00:30
🔔
  1. Discard the supernatant.
  2. Remove residual supernatant with a 100 µL pipette.
  3. Resuspend the bacteria pellet in 100 µL LB medium.
  4. Plate the 100 µL on the second LB agar Plate.
  5. Incubate the plates at 37 °C overnight or for blue/white selection for up to 48 h.
ℹ️ Plates can be stored @ 4°C for up to four weeks.

Proceed with Suitable Follow-up Protocol.

  • Bacterial Expression Culture
  • Bacterial Plasmid Preparation Culture

item.title: Bacterial Transformation Following PCR and Gel Extraction
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
heating block with shaker function
bucket of ice

Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications  Location
pipetmans and sterile pipette tips
reaction tube 1.5 mL 1/80 transformations
1/transformation
1/transformation		 for mastermix
for reaction
for LB medium
Reagents & Solutions⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
Luria-Bertani medium 1 mL/transformations
LB agar plate 2/transformations with suitable selection antibiotic
with X-gal for blue-white selection
X-gal for blue/white selection if not already in plate
restriction enzyme buffer 10x 2.5 µL/transformation default: 10 Tango buffer
Biological Materials⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Amount Specifications  Location
suitable restriction enzyme(s) ~1-2 µL/transformation
T4 DNA ligase 1 U/µL ~1 µL/transformation
PCR product 7.5 µL 10 ng/µL
acceptor plasmid 2.5 µL 10 ng/µL
one-shot of suitable competent bacteria 1/transformation

Procedure:

Selecting a suitable Strain:

Strain Application Features
E. coli DH5α medium-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli TOP10 high-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli XL1blue plasmid DNA expression
with blue/white screening
E. coli BL21(DE3) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli BL21(DE3) pLysS (toxic) protein expression T7 Inhibitor
E. coli Rosetta(DE3) (eucaryotic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C41(DE3) toxic protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C43(DE3) toxic membrane protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase

Vector Generation from PRC Produkt:

  1. Prepare the mastermix:
Volume Reagent Concentration c1 [ng/µL]
Mass m1 [ng]		 Concentration c2 [ng/µL]
Mass m2 [ng]
8.5 µL dsH2O
2.5 µL restriction enzyme buffer (default: Tango buffer) 10x
1 µL DTT/ATP 250 mM/12.5 mM 10 mM/500 µM
1 µL T4 DNA ligase 1 U/µL
1 µL restriction enzyme(s) of choice Enzyme amount:
= 15 µL

Number of samples:
